title: Run-heavy Steelers aim for balance with Rodgers
content: Steelers offensive coordinator Arthur Smith said he hopes last year's run-heavy offense can transition into more of a run-pass balance under new quarterback Aaron Rodgers.

title: Sources: Mavs join in denying Knicks' requests
content: The Knicks have now been denied permission to speak with Dallas Mavericks coach Jason Kidd, Timberwolves coach Chris Finch and Rockets coach Ime Udoka, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Dobbins defends claim father played for Yankees
content: Red Sox rookie Hunter Dobbins said there is nothing nefarious about the connections he said his father had to the Yankees despite a report saying the claims were nefarious.

title: Buxton's 479-foot blast MLB's 2nd-longest of '25
content: The Twins' Byron Buxton crushed a three-run home run that traveled 479 feet Wednesday against the Rangers, the second-longest homer in the majors this season.

title: Sources: Suns, Durant rep consider trade options
content: The Suns and Kevin Durant's business partner, Boardroom CEO Rich Kleiman, are sifting through trade scenarios as the sides are expected to work together on potential destinations for the 15-time All-Star, sources told ESPN.

title: Sources: Raiders add ex-Bengal Pratt to LB mix
content: The Raiders have signed former Bengals inside linebacker Germaine Pratt to a one-year, $4.25 million deal, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: McCutchen passes Clemente on Pirates' HR list
content: Andrew McCutchen moved past Hall of Famer Roberto Clemente into third place on the Pirates' career home run list Wednesday when he blasted his 241st long ball in 12 seasons with the franchise.

title: ü§ù Five Kevin Durant trade proposals
content: With the Suns and Durant meeting to sift through trade destinations, our NBA insiders break down five deals that work -- and pick a winner in the potential KD sweepstakes.

title: U.S. Open storylines: Scheffler's dominance, DeChambeau's chances and how hard Oakmont will play
content: Is it Scottie Scheffler vs. the field this week? Could Oakmont produce an over-par winner? We look at five storylines to watch this week.

title: The return of Javy Baez: How Detroit's $140 million man went from nearly off the roster to thriving
content: Months after hitting rock bottom, the Tigers' highest-paid player has rediscovered himself -- in a new role.

title: What all 30 MLB teams must do before the trade deadline
content: Is your team going to make a midsummer splash? Here's how the next few weeks could decide the season.

title: 32 looming questions under center: What every NFL team still needs to answer about its QB situation
content: Will Philly's coordinator swap impact Jalen Hurts? Are Patrick Mahomes and Jayden Daniels headed for big years? Could Lamar Jackson get another big payday?

title: NFL minicamp updates: Christian McCaffrey feels good again, Jets get Justin Fields experience
content: The majority of NFL mandatory minicamps are in action this week. Our reporters have the latest from around the league.

title: 'Hard work does pay off': At 17, Mason Howell is the youngest player in the U.S. Open field
content: Howell is a high school junior from Georgia who shot 63-63 in qualifying to get into the field. How did he get here, and what is he hoping for from the biggest week of his golfing career.

title: Our latest NBA mock draft: Back-and-forth on team need vs. best value
content: Best player available? Fill a need? We played out both strategies for 30 first-round slots in the draft.

title: 'Built for this time of year': How Sam Bennett transformed into a playoff MVP candidate
content: One shift in Game 3 encapsulated everything that the veteran center can do on the ice. Here's how he got here.

title: Whose NHL draft stock rose, declined at the scouting combine?
content: The annual event took place this past week in Buffalo -- with major repercussions for the draft on June 27-28.

title: All you need to know one year out from the 2026 World Cup
content: It's Messi and Ronaldo's last dance, and new stars will be born. Just how far can the U.S. go? The big talking points 12 months out from the World Cup.

title: Can Amtrak's busy Northeast Corridor handle the 2026 World Cup?
content: The congested stretch from Boston to Washington is already beleaguered by breakdowns and spotty service.

title: Tuchel: My mom finds Bellingham rage 'repulsive'
content: England manager Thomas Tuchel has said he understands criticism of Jude Bellingham after the midfielder's emotions boiled over during the shock defeat to Senegal on Tuesday.

title: Switzerland routs U.S. in Gold Cup sendoff loss
content: The United States gave up four goals in the first half and looked unprepared for next year's World Cup, getting routed by Switzerland 4-0 in a friendly on Tuesday in Nashville, losing its fourth straight game for the first time since 2007.

title: Sporting demand more than $80M for Gy√∂keres
content: Sporting CP striker Viktor Gy√∂keres will not be available for ‚Ç¨70 million ($80m) this summer, the club's president has warned amid interest from Manchester United.

title: Grealish left out of Man City Club World Cup squad
content: Jack Grealish has been left out of Manchester City's 28-man squad for the Club World Cup, the Premier League side confirmed on Wednesday.

title: Chelsea CWC squad: Delap in; Sterling, F√©lix out
content: Chelsea have confirmed that Liam Delap has been included in their Club World Cup squad, while Raheem Sterling and Jo√£o F√©lix have been left out.

title: Van de Ven: 'Strange' choice to sack Postecoglou
content: Tottenham Hotspur defender Micky van de Ven has described the decision to sack manager Ange Postecoglou as "strange."

title: Alexis asks for forgiveness as Chile miss '26 WC
content: Chile will miss their third straight World Cup after losing 2-0 at Bol√≠via on Tuesday to remain last in South America's 10-team round-robin competition.

title: Inter Miami's key to Club World Cup success? Rest Messi in MLS
content: Lionel Messi is perhaps the greatest soccer player of all time, but his MLS team Inter Miami tends to reserve him for the bigger games and competitions -- like this summer's Club World Cup.

title: Wetzel: It's new rules, same old game in NCAA athlete pay
content: College athletics is back in the rules business now that schools can directly pay players, Dan Wetzel writes.

title: Biggest surprise, head-scratcher and more from the transfer cycle
content: Which teams improved -- or hurt -- their outlook? We award winners and losers of this offseason's cycle.

title: Rankings: Janelle Salaun makes her debut
content: Janelle Salaun makes her first appearance in the fantasy women's basketball rankings while Jewell Loyd and Aliyah Boston might not be on the decline for long.

title: Hot potato! Get rid of these impostors before it's too late
content: Tristan H. Cockcroft takes a look at the current stats and passes judgment on which hot players need to go.

title: Respite In Heatwave Conditions Likely Over Northwest India From June 14
content: After days of intense heat, a gradual respite in heatwave conditions is likely over Northwest India beginning June 14, according to the latest forecast by the India Meteorological Department (IMD).

title: Gujarat Reports Over 200 New Covid Cases In 24 Hours
content: As Covid-19 cases continue to rise across India, the number of active infections has now crossed 6,815 nationwide.

title: "China, India Creating A Certain New Equilibrium", Says S Jaishankar
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar while speaking at GMF Brussels Forum 2025 said that there is a complex equilibrium in the world as India and China have risen to power, and these countries also happen to be neighbours.

title: Canada Town Near Vancouver Ready To Evacuate As Fire Nears
content: Residents of a town near Vancouver were on stand-by to evacuate Wednesday as Canada's devastating wildfire season worsened, with officials warning weather conditions through the summer were ripe for further blazes.

title: NDTV Exclusive: Axiom-4 Launch Delays Unusual? Astrophysicist Neil deGrasse Tyson Explains
content: SpaceX's Crew Dragon spacecraft, which will carry Indian astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla and three other crew members to the International Space Station as part of the Axion-4 mission, was delayed again on Wednesday - for the fourth time since May 29.

title: North Korea Will Always Stand With Russia, Kim Jong Un Tells Putin
content: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un said in a message to Russian President Vladimir Putin that his country will always stand with Moscow, state media reported on Thursday.

title: Congress Expels Digvijaya Singh's Brother For Remarks On Rahul Gandhi
content: The Congress on Wednesday expelled former Madhya Pradesh MLA Laxman Singh, who is brother of ex-chief minister Digvijaya Singh, from the primary membership of the party for six years for "anti-party activities".

title: Army Jawan On Leave Beaten To Death In Rajasthan, 2 Detained: Cops
content: In a shocking incident, Army Havildar Vikram Singh (40) was allegedly beaten to death by two youths in Palota Ka Bas village, under Surajgarh police station limits in Rajasthan's Jhunjhunu district.

title: 'Red Alert' In Delhi As Temperature Hits 51.9 Degrees, Rain Expected After June 13
content: A red alert was issued for Delhi as it remained in the grip of an intense heatwave, with temperatures ranging from 40.9 to 45.0 degrees Celsius across various weather stations on Wednesday.

title: 5 Injured After Mob Clashes With Cops Near Kolkata, BJP Seeks Central Forces
content: Tension simmered in the Rabindranagar area near Kolkata on Wednesday as a violent clash between two groups spiralled into widespread unrest, leaving several police personnel injured and multiple vehicles vandalised.

title: 'This Isn't real': Teacher's Narrow Escape From Austria School Shooter
content: A teacher told AFP Wednesday how he found himself in a corridor with the shooter who killed 10 people in an Austrian school as he fled his empty classroom.

title: Trump Tries To "Liberate" Los Angeles, Meets With Resistance From Residents
content: US President Donald Trump says he sent in the National Guard and Marines to "liberate" Los Angeles from the violence of protesters, but some residents of Little Tokyo, a neighborhood hit hardest by the unrest say "no thanks" Mr. President.

title: At Least 3 Centuries-Old Monasteries Damaged In Greece Quake
content: At least three centuries-old Greek monasteries in the religious enclave of Mount Athos were damaged in an earthquake over the weekend, the culture ministry said Wednesday.

title: Pakistan, Troubled By Thoughts Of A Deterrent For BrahMos, Looks Beyond China
content: Ever since India's precision strikes first destroyed its terror infrastructure and later its air bases and military installations during Operation Sindoor, one question has kept Pakistan worried - How to defend itself against India's BrahMos missile?

title: Goa-Born Christian Pak Man Seeks Citizenship Under CAA, Top Court Says...
content: The Supreme Court has refused to entertain an appeal from a Goa-born Pakistani Catholic man, who sought a direction to the Centre to grant him citizenship under the Citizenship Amendment Act or CAA, citing religious persecution in Pakistan.

title: Exotic Wedding, 19 Plots, Villa, 3 Buildings: Telangana Engineer Booked For Corruption
content: A wedding in Thailand for his son, on which crores were spent, a villa, three independent buildings - this lifestyle and assets may seem like they belong to a wealthy businessman, but they are allegedly of an executive engineer in Telangana.

title: Trump Tells New US Citizens To "Fiercely Guard" The American Way Of Life
content: In the address, Trump welcomes new citizens into what he calls the nation's "national family," emphasising that US citizenship is not just a legal status, but a "sacred honour" that carries profound responsibilities.

title: Harvey Weinstein Found Guilty On A Sex Crimes Charge In New York Retrial
content: A Manhattan jury found Harvey Weinstein guilty on a sex crimes charge on Wednesday in a retrial after a state appeals court last year overturned the former movie mogul's 2020 conviction.

title: Ashwini Vaishnaw Suspends 4 after After Dilapidated Train Sent To Pick Soldiers
content: Four railway officials have been suspended after a dilapidated train was allotted to carry Border Security Force personnel to Jammu and Kashmir for security duty during the Amarnath Yatra.

title: 'Love Triangle Murder' In Tripura, Body Of Missing Man Found In Ice-Cream Freezer
content: The mystery behind the disappearance of a youth from Agartala's Indranagar area was solved on Wednesday, with his body being discovered from inside a trolley bag hidden in an ice-cream freezer.

title: Project Pelican: Canada busts drug racket financing anti-India activities
content: Canadian authorities have dismantled a major narco-terror network, dubbed Project Pelican, with alleged ties to Khalistan sympathizers. The operation seized 479 kg of cocaine, valued at $47.9 million, and arrested nine individuals, including seven of Indian origin. Investigations reveal the network used commercial trucking routes from the US, linked to Mexican cartels, to traffic drugs.

title: Honeymoon murder: Sonam eyed as mastermind; Raj just a pawn; police hunt for hidden flat
content: Investigators now suspect Sonam Raghuvanshi, involved in the honeymoon murder case, might be the mastermind, manipulating Raj Kushwaha with promises of love. Raj may have unknowingly facilitated her escape, as Sonam allegedly planned a hideout in Indore. She remained there while searches were conducted, later fleeing to Uttar Pradesh when the plan unraveled.

title: In kharif season, water levels at 2 key Pakistan dams near ‚Äòdead levels'
content: Pakistan faces a growing water crisis as reduced flows from Indian rivers, particularly the Indus, Jhelum, and Chenab, lead to greater discharge than inflow. This situation, exacerbated by India's dam desilting, threatens key agricultural provinces like Punjab and Sindh. With monsoon rains still weeks away and the Indus Water Treaty suspended, Pakistan anticipates significant water shortages for farming.

title: Census 2027 goes digital; data in 9 months; mobile app to replace paper forms
content: India's Census 2027 aims for a swift data release by late 2027, leveraging digital technology for the first time. Enumerators will use mobile apps in 16 languages, offering citizens a self-enumeration option. This tech-driven approach, including pre-coded responses and intelligent character recognition, promises to significantly reduce processing time compared to previous censuses, with a dedicated portal for management and monitoring.

title: Full India-US trade pact may take time; govt awaits clarity on Trump‚Äôs policy
content: India and the US are aiming to finalize an initial trade deal by July 9, but a comprehensive agreement may take longer due to the Trump administration's evolving trade policies. Key issues include tariff implementation, competitiveness for Indian exporters, and protecting sensitive sectors like agriculture.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang: There‚Äôs a new programming language. It is called‚Ä¶
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang recently highlighted AI's transformative potential, stating it democratizes programming by enabling users to instruct computers using natural language. He likened programming AI to guiding a person, emphasizing the ease with which AI can now perform complex tasks like writing poems.

title: Elon Musk called Trump before posting regret over online feud
content: Elon Musk reached out to Donald Trump, expressing regret for his critical social media posts after a phone call between the two. This reconciliation attempt follows a public feud sparked by policy disagreements and personal attacks, with Trump previously dismissing any reconciliation.

title: Does India trust Trump? EAM says nat‚Äôl interest is the pivot, not personalities
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar emphasized India's commitment to strengthening ties with the US, irrespective of political leadership, citing it as crucial for India's interests. He cautioned Europe about the potential repercussions of ignoring terrorism, referencing Osama bin Laden's presence in Pakistan.

title: 'Housefull 5' closes in on Rs 120 crore; earns Rs 8 crore on Wednesday at box office
content: Akshay Kumar's 'Housefull 5', directed by Tarun Mansukhani, has stormed the box office, earning over Rs 100 crore in its first six days despite competition from 'Thug Life'. The film features a star-studded cast and a new mystery twist set on a cruise ship, where three characters named Jolly are suspects in a billionaire's murder.

title: Deloitte's well-being subsidy program: US workers get a new addition
content: Deloitte US is now allowing employees to use their wellness subsidy on items like Lego sets and puzzles, aiming to alleviate stress and boost morale. This update to the benefits program, offering up to $1,000 annually, has been met with excitement by many, though some remain skeptical amidst challenges in the company's government consulting sector.

title: Social security cover up from 24% in 2019 to 64%: ILO report
content: India's social protection coverage has significantly expanded, reaching 64.3% of the population and covering approximately 94 crore citizens, according to the ILO. The government is actively registering gig workers to provide them with targeted benefits. However, India still faces challenges with child labor, with over 10 million children estimated to be in labor.

title: Is Angelina Jolie and Brad Pitt's daughter engaged to actor Elijah Cooper? what we know
content: Zahara Jolie-Pitt, daughter of Angelina Jolie and Brad Pitt, ignited engagement rumors after being photographed with a diamond ring while leaving Craig's restaurant with actor Elijah Cooper. The 20-year-old's ring sparked speculation, amplified by Cooper following Zahara's private Instagram account. While neither Zahara nor her family have commented, Cooper's background as an actor, Morehouse College student, and streetwear company co-founder adds intrigue to the unfolding story.

title: ‚ÄòCannot have nuclear weapons‚Äô:Trump vows to stop Iran; US orders Iraq embassy exit
content: Amid rising tensions and a partial US embassy evacuation in Iraq, Donald Trump has firmly stated that the United States will prevent Iran from acquiring nuclear weapons. Diplomatic efforts to revive the nuclear deal face hurdles, particularly regarding uranium enrichment.

title: Google offers buyouts to employees who 'aren't feeling excited about ‚Ä¶
content: Google is offering buyouts to thousands of U.S. employees across various divisions, including Search and core engineering, as part of cost-cutting measures amid significant AI investments. The "Voluntary Exit Program" aims to provide a supportive exit for employees who feel misaligned with the company's strategy or are struggling to meet expectations.

title: Wife kills hubby 18 yrs after marriage,dumps body in river with lover‚Äôs help
content: In Siddharthnagar, Sangeeta Devi and her lover, Anil Shukla, were arrested for murdering Sangeeta's husband, Kannan Kumar. Sangeeta poisoned Kannan after a temple visit and, with Anil, threw his body into the Rapti river. She then filed a missing person report, but inconsistencies led to her confession. Kannan's brother had already suspected foul play due to marital issues.

title: Indian detained at Newark had no visa, wasn‚Äôt fit to travel: Govt
content: The Indian government confirmed that an Indian national detained at Newark Airport entered the U.S. illegally without a valid visa and was being deported following a court order. Authorities restrained him due to disruptive behavior during transit and admitted him to a medical facility. The Indian Consulate in New York is engaged with U.S.

title: SC: Homebuyer seeking refund can't ask builder to reimburse loan interest
content: The Supreme Court has ruled that homebuyers seeking refunds for project delays are not entitled to reimbursement for home loan interest paid. The court clarified that developers are only obligated to refund the principal amount and compensate with interest as per the agreement.

title: Diplomatic setback? Cong targets PM over US gen's Pak praise
content: The Congress party has intensified its criticism of Prime Minister Modi, demanding answers on post-Pahalgam security challenges and foreign policy. They questioned Modi regarding a US General's praise of Pakistan as a counter-terrorism partner, calling it a diplomatic setback for India which had sent delegations to expose Pakistan's stand on terror.

title: Post Pahalgam attack, anti-terror squad deployed for 1st time at Valley of Flowers
content: Uttarakhand Police has deployed an anti-terror squad at Ghangaria, near the Valley of Flowers and Hemkund Sahib, following the Pahalgam terror attack. This unprecedented security measure aims to safeguard tourists and pilgrims visiting the popular Himalayan sites.

title: RTIs filed over samosas & grooms, Bombay HC irked by misuse
content: The Bombay High Court has criticized the misuse of the Right to Information (RTI) Act, citing frivolous applications like one seeking the number of samosas served daily in a government office. Hearing a PIL regarding delays in disposing of second appeals, the court noted the Act's beneficial purpose is being undermined.

title: Telangana phone-tapping: SIB ex-chief admits to political surveillance
content: Former SIB chief T Prabhakar Rao admitted to political surveillance by a special operations team during his tenure, claiming senior police officials were aware. He stated the SOT, formed in 2018, exceeded its anti-Naxal mandate, operating under DSP G Praneeth Rao.

title: Judicial overreach risks unsettling power balance, says Justice Kant
content: Justice Surya Kant cautioned against judicial overreach, emphasizing the importance of restraint and facilitating democratic dialogue rather than supplanting the legislature. CJI B R Gavai, echoing similar concerns, warned against judicial activism turning into 'judicial terrorism,' highlighting the challenges posed by social media's influence on public perception and the judiciary's independence.

title: Caste survey decision by Cong brass, not Karnataka government, says CM Siddaramaiah
content: Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah clarified that the Congress high command, not his government, decided to conduct a fresh caste survey, amidst concerns about potential backlash from his core voter base. He stated that the 2015 report was accepted in principle, addressing complaints about outdated data.

title: SC rejects plea: Goa-born Pakistani denied CAA relief; asked to approach HC
content: The Supreme Court declined to hear a plea from a Goa-born Pakistani Catholic man seeking Indian citizenship under the CAA, as he arrived after the 2014 cutoff date. Citing religious persecution in Pakistan and an expiring passport, he requested visa extension, but the court directed him to the Bombay High Court.

title: HC suspends Karnataka ex-mantri Reddy‚Äôs conviction, sentence
content: The Telangana High Court suspended the conviction and sentence of Gali Janardhan Reddy in an illegal mining case, granting him bail and potentially saving his MLA position. The court also extended bail to three others involved and stayed the conviction of OMC.

title: How a 'mangalsutra' made Sonam prime suspect in her husband's murder investigation
content: Meghalaya police cracked the honeymoon murder case of Raja Raghuvanshi, revealing that his wife, Sonam Raghuvanshi, orchestrated his killing. Sonam's 'mangalsutra' and ring, left behind at a homestay, raised suspicion. Police investigations led to Sonam's arrest in Uttar Pradesh, along with her boyfriend and contract killers, exposing a conspiracy that unfolded during what was supposed to be a romantic getaway.

title: Josh Allen marries Hailee; calls it 'right choice'; fans say it won‚Äôt last
content: Buffalo Bills' Josh Allen recently married Hailee Steinfeld in a beautiful California wedding. Allen expressed his happiness, stating Steinfeld makes everything easier and that marrying her was the best decision of his life. However, some fans have expressed concern, referencing divorce rates and Allen's past relationship, while others doubted Steinfeld's fidelity with co-actor Michael B. Jordan.

title: Since 1960, poll rolls being shared with parties: CEC Gyanesh Kumar
content: Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar addressed Rahul Gandhi's voter fraud claims indirectly, highlighting the transparent electoral roll revision process shared with political parties since 1960. Speaking at an international conference, Kumar emphasized the rigorous annual exercise ensures electoral integrity.

title: Cops hurt, govt vehicles set afire in West Bengal violence
content: In Rabindranagar-Akra near Maheshtala, clashes erupted over a disputed construction site, injuring five policemen, including DC (Port) Harikrishna Pai. Protesters damaged vehicles and set a bike ablaze, prompting police to use lathicharge and tear gas. Authorities have arrested four individuals and are conducting route marches to maintain order.

title: Mamata restores OBC quota to 17%; Muslim groups rise to 80; BJP slams 'appeasement' bid
content: Bengal's revised OBC list, presented in the assembly, features 140 subgroups, with a higher Muslim representation at 57.1%. This revision aims to restore the 17% OBC reservation, addressing the legal challenges that had paused admissions and recruitments. Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee emphasized backwardness as the sole criterion, countering opposition claims of appeasement politics, as the state resumes issuing OBC certificates.

title: Ax-4 mission setback: LOX leak halts launch; ISRO insists on crew safety
content: Following the detection of glitches in SpaceX's Falcon-9 rocket, Isro prioritized astronaut safety, leading to launch delays for the Axiom-4 mission, which includes Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla. Isro, under Chairman V Narayanan, emphasized the need to resolve a liquid oxygen leak and control actuator issue before proceeding. Partners decided to postpone the launch for repairs and validation, ensuring crew well-being.

title: On relations with Sachin Pilot, Ashok Gehlot says, 'When were we ever apart?'
content: Ashok Gehlot hinted at a possible reconciliation with Sachin Pilot. He stated that they were never far apart. Gehlot attended a memorial event for Rajesh Pilot in Dausa. Several Congress leaders were present at the ceremony. The Gehlot-Pilot feud began in December 2018. Pilot led a rebellion against Gehlot in July 2020. Pilot was then removed from his positions.

title: Stanton shines in rehab; Aaron Judge jokes ‚Äòonly singles?‚Äô; return date still pending
content: Giancarlo Stanton's rehab game with the Somerset Patriots saw him hit two singles, driving in three runs, after recovering from an elbow injury. Aaron Judge playfully teased Stanton about the lack of home runs. While there's no set return date, manager Aaron Boone notes Stanton is improving and hitting the ball hard, raising hopes for his comeback.

title: 'Rare' leverage: How 'magnetic' Xi made Trump blink - and won US-China trade war
content: China's control over rare earth minerals, essential for modern technology, brought the US back to the negotiating table. Beijing strategically used export restrictions on these minerals, disrupting global industries from automotive to defense. This action forced the US to ease trade restrictions in exchange for China resuming rare earth shipments.

title: Trump‚Äôs LA playbook: Victory in violence - 'We couldn‚Äôt script this better'
content: Donald Trump deployed troops in Los Angeles due to immigration protests. This action sparked legal challenges from California Governor Gavin Newsom. Protests spread to other cities. Trump defended the move, citing a need for order. Newsom accused Trump of abusing power. The situation provides political opportunities for both Trump and Newsom.

title: ‚ÄòLal Salam‚Äô in Srinagar: CPM demands restoration of Article 370, talks with Pakistan
content: CPM's convention in Srinagar advocated for the restoration of Article 370 and dialogue with Pakistan, a rare stance amidst prevailing demands for statehood. M Alexander Baby criticized the abrogation as a betrayal and refuted claims of peace and development, highlighting inadequate compensation for shelling victims.

title: 'I still don't get it': Rohit Sharma's cryptic post keeps fans guessing - See pic
content: Following his Test retirement announcement in May, Indian ODI captain Rohit Sharma intrigued fans with a recent Instagram post featuring toys and a humorous caption about his daughters' explanations. The 38-year-old, despite a dip in form during the 2024-25 season, had a significant Test career, amassing 4,301 runs.

title: Exclusive: Bangladeshi player deported from India; 80-yo legend Rani Hamid 'disturbed' by events
content: Bangladeshi chess player Rani Hamid, 80, arrived in Delhi for a tournament, but her companion Ashiya Sultana was denied entry and deported due to a previous visa violation. This incident has deeply upset Hamid, impacting her performance in the competition. Despite the emotional distress, she appreciates the support from the Delhi Chess Association.

title: After Op Sindoor, India conducts military exercises with other countries
content: Following recent tensions with Pakistan, India has engaged in a series of military exercises to bolster its defense capabilities and international cooperation. These include anti-submarine operations with the UK in the Arabian Sea, joint Special Forces drills with the US, and upcoming trilateral wargames in Mongolia, focusing on interoperability and peacekeeping readiness.

title: 'Done deal': Trump jumps the gun on US-China trade agreement
content: Donald Trump says the US and China have a trade deal. This follows talks in London. China states a framework exists. It aims to implement a consensus. This was reached earlier. The consensus involves tariff suspensions. Trump claims China will supply rare earths. The US will allow Chinese students. He says tariffs favor the US.

title: Beach Boys fame Brian Wilson passes away at 82; Family 'heartbroken and at a loss for words'
content: Brian Wilson, the creative genius behind the Beach Boys, has passed away at 82. His family announced his death, expressing their heartbreak. Wilson shaped the band's iconic sound, blending carefree themes with deeper emotions. His groundbreaking album, 'Pet Sounds,' remains a timeless masterpiece. Born in California, Wilson's musical talent propelled the Beach Boys to fame with hits like 'Surfin' USA.'

title: 'Kohli could have been handled better': Shastri on retirement - Watch
content: Ravi Shastri expressed his sadness over Virat Kohli's sudden retirement from Test cricket, acknowledging Kohli's significant impact as a player and ambassador, especially overseas. Shastri believes Kohli's exit could have been managed more thoughtfully, suggesting better communication was needed. He reminisced about Kohli's captaincy, highlighting the team's success and Kohli's commitment to Test cricket.

title: Does 'Housefull 5' success reinstate fact that mass comedies always lure audience?
content: Housefull 5's impressive box office performance, grossing Rs 116.62 crore in India until Wednesday, suggests the enduring appeal of mass comedies. Experts attribute the film's success to its well-made entertainment value, suspenseful elements, and the established 'Housefull' brand. The absence of competition and Akshay Kumar's star power also contributed significantly, drawing audiences to this latest installment.

title: Close call: Civilian plane narrowly escapes Houthi missile intercepted mid-air - Video
content: A Houthi ballistic missile, aimed at Israeli civilians, was intercepted by Israeli air defenses, narrowly avoiding a collision with a civilian plane. The attack, claimed by the Iran-backed Houthis, triggered sirens across central Israel and the West Bank. In response, the Israeli Navy conducted its first strike on Yemen, targeting infrastructure at the Hodeida port.

title: How Max Verstappen ended up one penalty point away from a one-race ban
content: Max Verstappen heads to the Canadian Grand Prix on the brink of a one-race ban with one more infringement could see him miss out on valuable championship points.

title: Pound for pound: Dvalishvili leapfrogs MMA GOAT
content: UFC men's bantamweight champion Merab Dvalishvili's submission win over Sean O'Malley was enough to pass the best fighter in MMA history, but was it enough to claim the top spot?

title: Forget the World Cup, USMNT doesn't look ready for the Gold Cup
content: Tuesday's capitulation will no doubt leave Mauricio Pochettino wondering what he has gotten himself into.

title: From U.S. to Suriname, one thing to know about every team
content: With the Gold Cup set to kick off on June 14, we provide the narratives, star names and trivia you need to know for every team in the 2025 tournament.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool continue chase for Isak
content: Liverpool continue to keep tabs on a possible move for Newcastle United's Alexander Isak. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 16 players to trade for or trade away in dynasty leagues
content: running backs tend to have shorter careers because of the physical demands of the position . since 2010, there have been 105 seasons with 250 or more fantasy points . of those, 98 seasons came from RBs between the ages of 21 and 28 .

title: From wedding vows to machete blows: Inside the chilling Meghalaya murder - Plot revealed in 10 pics
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports .

title: Where Indiana lands among the NBA's most surprising Finals runs
content: the Indiana Pacers host Game 3 of the NBA Finals on friday (8:30 p.m. ET, ABC) it will be the first Finals game in a quarter century . the Pacers needed to knock off a 64-win Cleveland Cavaliers in Round 2, then win a second series .

title: Oakmont is going to be the main character at the 2025 U.S. Open
content: oakmont Country Club has hosted 10 U.S. Opens now -- the most of any course in the country . the clubhouse is dotted with quaint homes . it's a barrier between the idyllic neighborhood and one of golf's most terrifying tests .

title: Adams: U.S. tunes out Donovan, Dempsey 'noise'
content: Mauricio Pochettino and Clint Dempsey are among those criticizing the men's national team . the pair share the american goals record with 57 goals each . "we don't talk about that internally as a group," Adams said during a Zoom interview .

title: The field of 8 is set: NCAA baseball tournament schedule, results
content: the field for the men's college world series in Omaha, Nebraska, is set . it'll be the Racers' first time in Omaha . four teams are making their first appearances in Omaha since winning the title the last time they made it this far .

title: College football's top 25 plays since 2000
content: a college football game guarantees you certain things, you will get tailgate smells . the top 25 plays of the 2000s are voted on by ESPN college football writers . some decided national titles, some provided all-time rivalry bragging rights .

title: Future Power Rankings: How all 68 Power 4 college football teams stack up
content: college football 's future power rankings have been reimagined as part of a changing sport . the rankings will examine the next two seasons -- in this case, the 2025 and 2026 seasons -- and function more as a snapshot of the landscape . a spring portal changes things, and QB rooms can look moderately or significantly different by late May or early June .

title: Tigers' Jobe needs season-ending elbow surgery
content: The Orioles pour it on late to take down the Tigers at Camden Yards. (0:57) Detroit Tigers  rookie right-hander  Jackson Jobe  needs season-ending Tommy John surgery on his pitching elbow, the AL Central leaders said Wednesday. Jobe,  ESPN's No. 7-ranked prospect  entering the season, was 4-1 with a 4.22 ERA in 10 starts this year. He has 39 strikeouts and 27 walks in 49 innings. He mentioned discomfort in the elbow during a start against the  San Francisco Giants  on May 28, then was placed on the 15-day injured list with a Grade 1 right flexor strain. Jobe was selected third overall out of high school in the 2021 amateur draft by the Tigers. He made his major league debut late last season when he was called up during the Tigers' playoff push and threw a combined four scoreless innings, giving up only one hit, in two relief appearances. Detroit entered Wednesday with the best record in the majors at 44-24. Information from The Associated Press was used in this report.

title: EA Sports FC 25 Title Update No. 15 improves ground passes
content: the latest Title Update for EA Sports FC 25 has arrived . players with high Passing attributes have received an accuracy increase on their ground passes . this is supposed to close the gap to athletes with passing-related PlayStyles . the developer wants both types of players to be viable .

title: What to know ahead of the Canadian Grand Prix
content: Max Verstappen could be under pressure this weekend at the Canadian grand prix . he is just one penalty point from a race ban following the incident with George Russell in Spain . the forecast for the 44th race at Montreal is set to be cloudy on Friday .

title: Chisholm hurt, Nola's potential return delayed
content: the fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . seven more matinees follow with the remaining seven tilts played under the lights . new york Yankees 3B jazz Chisholm Jr . left last night's game in the seventh inning due to a tight neck .

title: U.P. govt suppressed Maha Kumbh death toll, says Rahul Gandhi, cites BBC report
